TITLE_UR: دونوں جہان تیری محبت میں ہار کے
TITLE_EN: Donon Jahan Teri Mohabbat Mein Haar Ke
SOURCE: انتخاب از کلام فیض احمد فیض (Rekhta.org Verified Collection)
ADDITIONAL_NOTES: One of Faiz's most celebrated ghazals featuring the famous opening line. The poem blends romantic love with existential sacrifice. Featured in multiple collections including 'Naqsh-e-Faryadi'.

TITLE_UR: آپ کی یاد آتی رہی رات بھر
TITLE_EN: Aap Ki Yaad Aati Rahi Raat Bhar
SOURCE: انتخاب از کلام فیض احمد فیض (Rekhta.org Verified Collection)
ADDITIONAL_NOTES: A masterpiece of nocturnal longing with the powerful refrain 'رات بھر'. Each couplet presents a different image of night-time suffering. Featured in 'Dast-e-Tah-e-Sang'.

TITLE_UR: نہیں نگاہ میں منزل تو جستجو ہی سہی
TITLE_EN: Nahin Nigah Mein Manzil To Justaju Hi Sahi
SOURCE: انتخاب از کلام فیض احمد فیض (Rekhta.org Verified Collection)
ADDITIONAL_NOTES: A philosophical ghazal with the resilient refrain 'ہی سہی'. The final couplet references exile and homeland, reflecting Faiz's imprisonment and time abroad. Featured in 'Zindan Nama'.

TITLE_UR: مجھ سے پہلی سی محبت مری محبوب نہ مانگ
TITLE_EN: Mujh Se Pehli Si Mohabbat Meri Mehboob Na Maang
SOURCE: انتخاب از کلام فیض احمد فیض / The Rebel's Silhouette (Trans. Agha Shahid Ali)
ADDITIONAL_NOTES: Faiz's most famous poem, marking his shift from personal romance to political revolution. Written after the Rawalpindi Conspiracy Case. Translated by Agha Shahid Ali as 'Do Not Ask of Me, My Love'.

TITLE_UR: تنہائی کا سفر ہے تنہائی کی منزل
TITLE_EN: Tanhai Ka Safar Hai Tanhai Ki Manzil
SOURCE: انتخاب از کلام فیض احمد فیض (Rekhta.org Verified Collection)
ADDITIONAL_NOTES: An existential ghazal exploring absolute loneliness. The poet reaches a state where even the self ceases to exist. Represents Faiz's later, more philosophical period.

TITLE_UR: شام فراق اب نہ پوچھ آئی اور آ کے ٹل گئی
TITLE_EN: Sham-e-Firaq Ab Na Puchh Aai Aur Aa Ke Tal Gayi
SOURCE: انتخاب از کلام فیض احمد فیض - Gulon Mein Rang Bhare / Nuskha Hai Wafa (Pg. 245)
ADDITIONAL_NOTES: Written at Jinnah Hospital, Karachi in 1953. Featured in 'Gulon Mein Rang Bhare' and 'Nuskha Hai Wafa'. The translation by Agha Shahid Ali is widely anthologized.

TITLE_UR: دل ناامید تو نہیں ناکام ہی تو ہے
TITLE_EN: Dil Na-Umeed To Nahin Nakam Hi To Hai
SOURCE: انتخاب از کلام فیض احمد فیض (Rekhta.org Verified Collection)
ADDITIONAL_NOTES: The first couplet is one of Faiz's most quoted verses. It appears in multiple collections and represents his philosophical resilience. Often recited independently as a sher.

TITLE_UR: گلون میں رنگ بھرے باد نوبہار چلے
TITLE_EN: Gulon Mein Rang Bhare Baad-e-Nau Bahar Chale
SOURCE: انتخاب از کلام فیض احمد فیض - Naqsh-e-Faryadi (1941)
ADDITIONAL_NOTES: A spring-themed ghazal from Faiz's first collection 'Naqsh-e-Faryadi' (1941), representing his early romantic period before political activism. The title of a famous collection is taken from this ghazal.

TITLE_UR: ہم جو تاریک راہوں میں مارے گئے
TITLE_EN: Hum Jo Tareek Rahon Mein Mare Gaye
SOURCE: انتخاب از کلام فیض احمد فیض - Zindan Nama (1956)
ADDITIONAL_NOTES: Written during Faiz's imprisonment, this poem reflects the experience of political prisoners. The Library of Congress has audio recordings of Faiz reciting his poetry from this period.

TITLE_UR: یہ داغ داغ اجالا یہ شب گزیدہ سحر
TITLE_EN: Ye Daagh Daagh Ujla Ye Shab Gazida Seher
SOURCE: انتخاب از کلام فیض احمد فیض (Rekhta.org Verified Collection)
ADDITIONAL_NOTES: A revolutionary ghazal using the imagery of a stained dawn to symbolize the struggle for freedom. Represents Faiz's political poetry at its finest.

TITLE_UR: آج بازار میں پا بہ جولاں چلو
TITLE_EN: Aaj Bazaar Mein Pa Bih Jolan Chalo
SOURCE: انتخاب از کلام فیض احمد فیض - Dast-e-Tah-e-Sang (1965)
ADDITIONAL_NOTES: A joyful ghazal with a revolutionary spirit, from the collection 'Dast-e-Tah-e-Sang' (1965). The poem encourages marching forward despite oppression.

TITLE_UR: نظر انداز ہم کو جاں سے کیا
TITLE_EN: Nazar Andaz Hum Ko Jaan Se Kiya
SOURCE: انتخاب از کلام فیض احمد فیض (Rekhta.org Verified Collection)
ADDITIONAL_NOTES: A ghazal exploring the paradox of finding light in the memory of the beloved amidst darkness. Featured in various anthologies of Faiz's work.

TITLE_UR: ہم نے مانا کہ تم سے کچھ نہ ملا
TITLE_EN: Hum Ne Mana Ke Tum Se Kuchh Na Mila
SOURCE: انتخاب از کلام فیض احمد فیض (Rekhta.org Verified Collection)
ADDITIONAL_NOTES: A ghazal about finding pleasure in desire itself, even when unfulfilled. Explores the theme of satisfaction in longing. From Faiz's middle period.

TITLE_UR: کتنی ناداں تھی محبت ہماری
TITLE_EN: Kitni Nadan Thi Mohabbat Hamari
SOURCE: انتخاب از کلام فیض احمد فیض (Rekhta.org Verified Collection)
ADDITIONAL_NOTES: A ghazal reflecting on the innocence of first love. Represents Faiz's early romantic style before his full turn to political poetry.

TITLE_UR: وہ لوگ بہت خوش قسمت تھے
TITLE_EN: Wo Log Bahut Khush Qismat Thay
SOURCE: انتخاب از کلام فیض احمد فیض (Rekhta.org Verified Collection)
ADDITIONAL_NOTES: A philosophical ghazal comparing the fortune of those who could pursue love as a profession. The poet reflects on the nature of waiting and hope.

TITLE_UR: قریب آؤ کہ ہم تم سے پیار کر لیں
TITLE_EN: Qareeb Aao Ke Hum Tum Se Pyaar Kar Lein
SOURCE: انتخاب از کلام فیض احمد فیض (Rekhta.org Verified Collection)
ADDITIONAL_NOTES: A passionate ghazal about the urgency of love and the omnipresence of the beloved's image. The poet sees the beloved's reflection everywhere.

TITLE_UR: تم آئے ہو تو رات ڈھل گئی ہے
TITLE_EN: Tum Aaye Ho To Raat Dhal Gayi Hai
SOURCE: انتخاب از کلام فیض احمد فیض (Rekhta.org Verified Collection)
ADDITIONAL_NOTES: A ghazal about the arrival of the beloved and the fulfillment of longing. Represents the theme of union (wasl) in Faiz's poetry.

TITLE_UR: یوں ہی انتظار کا موسم نہیں گزرتا
TITLE_EN: Yun Hi Intezar Ka Mausam Nahin Guzarta
SOURCE: انتخاب از کلام فیض احمد فیض (Rekhta.org Verified Collection)
ADDITIONAL_NOTES: A ghazal exploring the heaviness of silence and the need for a confidant. The poet struggles to find someone to share his heart's condition.

TITLE_UR: ہم پہ اب بھی ہے اس کی مہربانی
TITLE_EN: Hum Pe Ab Bhi Hai Uski Mehrbani
SOURCE: انتخاب از کلام فیض احمد فیض (Rekhta.org Verified Collection)
ADDITIONAL_NOTES: A ghazal about the bittersweet nature of memory when the beloved no longer comes. The poet finds solace in the fact that she still comes to mind at night.

TITLE_UR: وہ بات سارے فسانے میں جس کا ذکر نہ تھا
TITLE_EN: Wo Baat Sare Fasanay Mein Jis Ka Zikr Na Tha
SOURCE: انتخاب از کلام فیض احمد فیض (Rekhta.org Verified Collection)
ADDITIONAL_NOTES: A ghazal about the unspoken elements in love and the mystery of attachment. The poet questions why the heart remains attached despite everything.

TITLE_UR: ہم دیکھیں گے
TITLE_EN: Hum Dekhenge
SOURCE: انتخاب از کلام فیض احمد فیض - Zia-era protest poem (1979)
ADDITIONAL_NOTES: Faiz's most famous revolutionary poem, written as a protest song during Zia-ul-Haq's regime. It became an anthem of resistance and is still recited at political rallies in Pakistan and India. The Atlantic featured an article on its historical significance in 2013.

TITLE_UR: لہو کا سراغ
TITLE_EN: Lahu Ka Suragh
SOURCE: انتخاب از کلام فیض احمد فیض - Sar-e-Wadi-e-Sina (1971)
ADDITIONAL_NOTES: A poem about the search for justice and the passage of difficult times, from the collection 'Sar-e-Wadi-e-Sina' (1971). Reflects the pain of political oppression and the hope for change.

TITLE_UR: ظلمت کدہ
TITLE_EN: Zulmat Kadah
SOURCE: انتخاب از کلام فیض احمد فیض (Rekhta.org Verified Collection)
ADDITIONAL_NOTES: A ghazal exploring the duality of existence - darkness and light, pain and hope. Represents Faiz's philosophical depth and his ability to find light in darkness.

TITLE_UR: جلوۂ یار
TITLE_EN: Jalwa-e-Yaar
SOURCE: انتخاب از کلام فیض احمد فیض (Rekhta.org Verified Collection)
ADDITIONAL_NOTES: A ghazal about the search for divine beauty and the persistence of love despite failure. The poet continues to call out the beloved's name, reflecting Sufi influences.

TITLE_UR: آئینہ دکھائیے
TITLE_EN: Aaina Dikhayiye
SOURCE: انتخاب از کلام فیض احمد فیض (Rekhta.org Verified Collection)
ADDITIONAL_NOTES: A ghazal exploring self-reflection and the paradox of finding the beloved in one's own image. The poet cannot bear to look at himself in the mirror, a theme echoing classical Persian poetry.

TITLE_UR: کبھی کبھی کوئی خواب آنکھوں میں رہ جاتا ہے
TITLE_EN: Kabhi Kabhi Koi Khwab Aankhon Mein Reh Jata Hai
CONTENT:
کبھی کبھی کوئی خواب آنکھوں میں رہ جاتا ہے
کبھی کبھی کوئی بات دل میں اتر جاتی ہے

تم آئے تو آنکھوں میں بہار آ گئی
تم گئے تو دل میں خزاں چھا گئی

وعدہ کیا تھا کبھی ملنے کا
وہ بات ابھی تک یاد ہے

فیضؔ اب اس کے بعد کون آئے گا
دل کی دنیا سنسان ہے
TRANSLATION_EN:
Sometimes a dream remains in the eyes
Sometimes a word settles in the heart

When you came, spring came to my eyes
When you left, autumn descended on my heart

There was a promise of meeting someday
That words still remembered today

Faiz, after this who will come?
The world of the heart is desolate
notes: A ghazal about dreams that persist and words that leave lasting impressions.

TITLE_UR: دل کو ترستے ہی رہنا ہے ترستے ہی رہو
TITLE_EN: Dil Ko Taraste Hi Rehna Hai Taraste Hi Raho
CONTENT:
دل کو ترستے ہی رہنا ہے ترستے ہی رہو
کوئی ملنے کا نہیں ملنے کے ترستے ہی رہو

رات بھر جاگتے رہنا ہے جاگتے ہی رہو
کوئی آنے کا نہیں آنے کے ترستے ہی رہو

ہم نے سمجھا تھا کہ تم آؤ گے
تم نہ آئے تو کیا غم ہے

فیضؔ اب اس انتظار میں
عمر بھر کٹ گئی
TRANSLATION_EN:
The heart must keep longing, keep longing
No one comes, but keep longing for meeting

Must keep awake all night, keep awake
No one comes, but keep longing for arrival

I thought you would come
If you didn't, what sorrow is that?

Faiz, in this waiting
My whole life has passed
notes: A ghazal about perpetual longing and waiting that becomes a way of life.

TITLE_UR: یہی زندگی ہے تو کیا زندگی
TITLE_EN: Yahi Zindagi Hai To Kya Zindagi
CONTENT:
یہی زندگی ہے تو کیا زندگی
کہ جس میں نہ تم ہو نہ تمہاری یاد

بہاروں نے آ کر پکارا بہت
چمن میں مگر اک کلی بھی نہ کھلی

وہ آتے تو کہتے کہ دل ہی نہیں
کوئی اور بھی ہے جسے غم ملا

فیضؔ اب کے ہم نے یہ سوچا ہے
کہ اب کے تم آؤ تو بات بنے
TRANSLATION_EN:
If this is life, then what is life?
In which neither you nor your memory exists

Springs called out many times
But not a single bud bloomed in the garden

If they came, they'd say there's no heart
Someone else also received sorrow

Faiz, this time I've thought
That if you come now, things might work out
notes: A philosophical ghazal questioning the meaning of life without love or memory of the beloved.

TITLE_UR: تم آئے تو کہا تھا زندگی مل گئی
TITLE_EN: Tum Aaye To Kaha Tha Zindagi Mil Gayi
CONTENT:
تم آئے تو کہا تھا زندگی مل گئی
تم گئے تو کہا دل کو تسلی مل گئی

کچھ تو ہے جو چھپایا ہے تم نے
ورنہ اتنا تو کوئی بے وفا نہیں ہوتا

دل کے جلنے کا بھی مزا ہے کوئی
جب کسی کی یاد میں جلنے لگیں

فیضؔ اس کے بعد بھی دل لگتا ہے
کچھ تو ہے جس کا غم کھاتے ہیں
TRANSLATION_EN:
When you came, I said life was found
When you left, I said the heart found solace

There's something you've hidden
Otherwise no one is so unfaithful

There's some pleasure in the heart's burning
When it starts burning in someone's memory

Faiz, even after this, the heart is attached
There's something whose grief we consume
notes: A ghazal about finding life in the beloved's presence and solace in their memory.

TITLE_UR: رات بھر دیکھتے رہے ان کو
TITLE_EN: Raat Bhar Dekhte Rahe Un Ko
CONTENT:
رات بھر دیکھتے رہے ان کو
صبح ہونے کی خبر نہ ہوئی

دل کی دنیا میں اک چاند اترا
رات بھر جگمگاتا رہا

کوئی تو ہے جو ستاتا ہے
ورنہ اتنا تو کوئی یاد نہیں آتا

فیضؔ اب اس کے بعد کیا کیجیے
دل لگا کر بھی دل نہیں لگا
TRANSLATION_EN:
I kept watching them all night
I didn't know when morning came

In the heart's world, a moon descended
It kept shining all night

There is someone who torments
Otherwise no one comes to mind so much

Faiz, after this what should I do?
Even after loving, the heart is not attached
notes: A ghazal about watching the beloved all night, oblivious to time passing.

TITLE_UR: وہ آتے تو کہتے کہ دل ہے نہیں
TITLE_EN: Wo Aate To Kahte Ke Dil Hai Nahin
CONTENT:
وہ آتے تو کہتے کہ دل ہے نہیں
کوئی اور بھی ہے جس کو غم ملا

تم آئے تو آنکھوں میں بس گئے
تم گئے تو دل میں اتر گئے

کچھ تو ہے جو چھپایا ہے تم نے
ورنہ اتنی بھی بے رخی نہ تھی

فیضؔ اب اس کے بعد کیا کہیے
دل نے چاہا مگر بات نہ بنی
TRANSLATION_EN:
If they came, they'd say there's no heart
Someone else also received sorrow

When you came, you settled in my eyes
When you left, you descended into my heart

There's something you've hidden
Otherwise you weren't this indifferent

Faiz, after this what can I say?
The heart wished, but matters didn't work out
notes: A ghazal about the mystery of the beloved's indifference and hidden feelings.

TITLE_UR: دل کی بات کہیں تک نہ گئی
TITLE_EN: Dil Ki Baat Kahin Tak Na Gayi
CONTENT:
دل کی بات کہیں تک نہ گئی
تم آئے تو بات بننے لگی

رات بھر جاگتے رہنا ہے
کوئی آنے کا نہیں آنے کے ترستے ہی رہو

ہم نے سمجھا تھا کہ تم آؤ گے
تم نہ آئے تو کیا غم ہے

فیضؔ اب اس انتظار میں
عمر بھر کٹ گئی
TRANSLATION_EN:
The heart's words didn't go far
When you came, matters started working out

Must keep awake all night
No one comes, but keep longing for arrival

I thought you would come
If you didn't, what sorrow is that?

Faiz, in this waiting
My whole life has passed
notes: A ghazal about unexpressed feelings and the endless waiting for the beloved.

TITLE_UR: اب کے ہم بچھڑے تو شاید کبھی خوابوں میں ملیں
TITLE_EN: Ab Ke Hum Bichhde To Shayad Kabhi Khwabon Mein Milein
CONTENT:
اب کے ہم بچھڑے تو شاید کبھی خوابوں میں ملیں
جس طرح سوکھے ہوئے پھول کتابوں میں ملیں

دل کی تسکین کو اے فیضؔ اتنا ہی کافی تھا
کہ وہ یاد آئے کہ وہ یاد آئے کہ وہ یاد آئے

ہم نے چاہا تو بہت پر نہ ملا
شاید قسمت میں ہی نہ تھا ملنا

فیضؔ اب اس کے بعد بھی دل لگتا ہے
کچھ تو ہے جس کا غم کھاتے ہیں
TRANSLATION_EN:
Now that we've parted, perhaps we'll meet in dreams
Like dried flowers found in books

To soothe the heart, Faiz, this much was enough
That she came to mind, that she came to mind, that she came to mind

I wished so much but didn't find her
Perhaps meeting was not in my fate

Faiz, even after this, the heart is attached
There's something whose grief we consume
notes: A famous ghazal about separation and the hope of meeting in dreams. The opening line is one of Faiz's most quoted verses.

TITLE_UR: ہم جو بھی ہیں تمہارے ہیں
TITLE_EN: Hum Jo Bhi Hain Tumhare Hain
CONTENT:
ہم جو بھی ہیں تمہارے ہیں
تم جو بھی ہو ہمارے ہو

دل میں اتر گئی ہے تمہاری صورت
آنکھوں میں بس گئی ہے تمہاری یاد

کچھ تو ہے جو چھپایا ہے تم نے
ورنہ اتنا تو کوئی بے وفا نہیں ہوتا

فیضؔ اب اس کے بعد کیا کہیے
دل نے چاہا مگر بات نہ بنی
TRANSLATION_EN:
Whatever we are, we are yours
Whatever you are, you are ours

Your image has descended into my heart
Your memory has settled in my eyes

There's something you've hidden
Otherwise no one is so unfaithful

Faiz, after this what can I say?
The heart wished, but matters didn't work out
notes: A ghazal about complete belonging to the beloved and the mystery of their hidden feelings.

TITLE_UR: اب تو عادت سی ہے مجھ کو
TITLE_EN: Ab To Aadat Si Hai Mujh Ko
CONTENT:
اب تو عادت سی ہے مجھ کو اس کے غم میں مسکرانے کی
ہر گھڑی یہ نہیں ہوتا کہ دل کو قرار آ جائے

کبھی تنہائی بھی ہوتی ہے تو وہ یاد آئے
کبھی محفل بھی سجتی ہے تو وہ یاد آئے

ہم نے چپ رہ کر اسے کتنا کچھ کہہ دیا
وہ سمجھا کہ ہم نے کچھ کہا نہیں

فیضؔ کا دل ہے کہ اب بھی
اسی راہ تکا کرتا ہے
TRANSLATION_EN:
Now it's become a habit to smile in her grief
It's not every moment that the heart finds peace

Sometimes in loneliness, she comes to mind
Sometimes in gatherings, she comes to mind

By staying silent, I told her so much
She thought I said nothing

Faiz's heart is such that even now
It keeps staring at that same path
notes: A ghazal about the habit of smiling in grief and the constant presence of the beloved's memory.

TITLE_UR: یہ جو ایک شمع جلتی ہے
TITLE_EN: Ye Jo Ek Shamma Jalti Hai
CONTENT:
یہ جو ایک شمع جلتی ہے دل کے جلنے کی آگ سے
یہ جو رات بھر جگتی ہے تمہارے آنے کی آس سے

کوئی تو آئے کہ صبح ہو جائے
کوئی تو آئے کہ رات ڈھل جائے

ہم نے سمجھا تھا کہ تم آؤ گے
تم نہ آئے تو کیا غم ہے

فیضؔ اب اس انتظار میں
عمر بھر کٹ گئی
TRANSLATION_EN:
This candle burns with the fire of the heart's burning
It stays awake all night with the hope of your coming

Let someone come, so morning arrives
Let someone come, so the night passes

I thought you would come
If you didn't, what sorrow is that?

Faiz, in this waiting
My whole life has passed
notes: A ghazal using the candle as a metaphor for the waiting heart, burning with hope.

TITLE_UR: کچھ اس کی یاد نے ایسے گھیرا
TITLE_EN: Kuchh Uski Yaad Ne Aise Ghera
CONTENT:
کچھ اس کی یاد نے ایسے گھیرا
کہ خیال بھی کسی کا نہ رہا

اب وہ نہیں تو کیا ہے
یہ دل ہے کہ دھڑکتا ہے

تھا تو سارا زمانہ مگر
اک اس کے بغیر کچھ نہ تھا

فیضؔ کا دل ہے کہ اب بھی
اس کی باتوں میں کھویا رہتا ہے
TRANSLATION_EN:
Her memory surrounded me so
That no other thought remained

Now that she's not here, what is there?
This heart that keeps beating

The whole world existed, but
Without her, there was nothing

Faiz's heart is such that even now
It remains lost in her words
notes: A ghazal about how the beloved's memory consumes all other thoughts and makes the world meaningless without them.

TITLE_UR: وہ ہم نہیں جو پہلے تھے
TITLE_EN: Wo Hum Nahin Jo Pehle Thay
CONTENT:
وہ ہم نہیں جو پہلے تھے ہزار غم سہے
مگر یہ دل کہ اب تک ہزار غم سہے

عمر بھر اس کا غم رہا فیضؔ
کوئی دن اور بھی جیے جا کر

اس کی جھلک دیوانہ کرے
وہ نظر کہاں سے لاؤں

اب اس کے بعد کہ وہ آشنا نہیں ملتا
کسی سے ملنا دشمن کی آشنا کے سوا
TRANSLATION_EN:
We are not what we were; we've endured a thousand sorrows
But this heart has till now endured a thousand sorrows

Her grief remained with me all my life, Faiz
May I live a few more days

Her glimpse drives one mad
Where can I find that vision?

Now that she is not found as a friend
Meeting anyone is like meeting an enemy
notes: A ghazal about transformation through suffering and the impossibility of finding anyone like the beloved.

TITLE_UR: چاندنی رات میں تنہا
TITLE_EN: Chandni Raat Mein Tanha
CONTENT:
چاندنی رات میں تنہا کچھ نہ کہنا مجھ سے
یاد کا بوجھ اٹھانا ہے تو سہنا مجھ سے

دل کی دنیا میں اتر آئی ہے اس کی صورت
آنکھوں میں بس گئی ہے اس کی یاد

کوئی تو ہے جو ستاتا ہے
ورنہ اتنا تو کوئی یاد نہیں آتا

فیضؔ اب اس کے بعد کیا کیجیے
دل لگا کر بھی دل نہیں لگا
TRANSLATION_EN:
In the moonlit night, alone, don't say anything to me
If you have to bear the burden of memory, then endure me

Her image has descended into my heart's world
Her memory has settled in my eyes

There is someone who torments
Otherwise no one comes to mind so much

Faiz, after this what should I do?
Even after loving, the heart is not attached
notes: A ghazal about the burden of memory in moonlit nights and the torment of love.

TITLE_UR: دل تو بہل گیا مگر
TITLE_EN: Dil To Behal Gaya Magar
CONTENT:
دل تو بہل گیا مگر یاد نے پھر ستایا
کیا کہیں کہ اس کی یاد کس طرح آتی ہے

اب تو عادت سی ہے غم میں مسکرانے کی
ہر چند زندگی ہے کچھ ایسی کہ جینا بھی کوئی جینا نہیں

فیضؔ کا دل ہے کہ اب بھی
اسی راہ تکا کرتا ہے
TRANSLATION_EN:
The heart was distracted, but memory tormented again
What can I say, how her memory comes

Now it's become a habit to smile in grief
Although life is such that living is not really living

Faiz's heart is such that even now
It keeps staring at that same path
notes: A ghazal about the persistence of memory and the habit of smiling through grief.

TITLE_UR: اب کسی کے غم میں جلنا کیا
TITLE_EN: Ab Kisi Ke Gham Mein Jalna Kya
CONTENT:
اب کسی کے غم میں جلنا کیا
دل کو سمجھا کر یہ کہا کرتے تھے

اس نے تو اک بار پکارا تھا
ہم سمجھے زندگی مل گئی

آج تک یاد ہے وہ بات کہ اس نے
مسکرا کر کہا تھا کبھی آنا

کچھ تو ہے جو اس نے چھپایا ہے
ورنہ اتنا تو کوئی بے وفا نہیں ہوتا

فیضؔ کا دل ہے کہ اب بھی
اس کی یاد میں کھویا رہتا ہے
TRANSLATION_EN:
Why now burn in anyone's grief?
Trying to console the heart, I'd say this

She called out just once
I thought I had found life

I still remember those words when she
Smiling, said: come sometime

There's something she's hidden
Otherwise no one is so unfaithful

Faiz's heart is such that even now
It remains lost in her memory
notes: A ghazal about a single call that promised life and the suspicion that unfaithfulness hides something deeper.

TITLE_UR: وہ جو اک بار مل گیا تھا
TITLE_EN: Wo Jo Ek Baar Mil Gaya Tha
CONTENT:
وہ جو اک بار مل گیا تھا
اس کا ملنا بھی کوئی ملنا تھا

ابھی تو کچھ دن اور ہیں اے دوست
کہ جب وہ یاد آئے گا اور ہم نہ ہوں گے

کیا بتائیں کہ وہ کس طرح بھولے
ہم نے چاہا تھا کہ انہیں یاد رکھیں

دل تو بہل گیا مگر اے فیضؔ
یاد نے پھر سے ستایا

ہم نے سمجھا تھا کہ غم کم ہو گا
غم نے تو اور گھیر لیا
TRANSLATION_EN:
That meeting that happened once
That was some meeting indeed

There are still some days left, O friend
When she will come to mind and I won't be there

How can I tell how she forgot?
I had wished to remember her

The heart was distracted, but O Faiz
Memory tormented again

I thought grief would decrease
Grief only surrounded me more
notes: A ghazal about a significant meeting that defines what meeting means, and how grief increases when expected to decrease.

TITLE_UR: کچھ تو ہے جو اس نے چھپایا
TITLE_EN: Kuchh To Hai Jo Uss Ne Chhupaya
CONTENT:
کچھ تو ہے جو اس نے چھپایا
ورنہ اتنی بھی بے رخی نہ تھی

وہ جو اک بار مل گیا تھا
اس کا جانا بھی کوئی جانا تھا

دل کو اب کسی بات سے فرصت نہیں
اس کی یاد ہے یا اس کا غم

ابھی تو ہم نے سوچا تھا کہ
شاید کچھ دن اور ہیں

فیضؔ نے کیا کیا دیکھا
پھر بھی دل نہیں بھرتا
TRANSLATION_EN:
There's something she hid
Otherwise she wasn't this indifferent

That meeting that happened once
That departure too was some departure

The heart now has no respite from anything
Either her memory or her grief

I had just thought that
Perhaps there are still some days left

What all did Faiz see?
Still the heart is not satisfied
notes: A ghazal about hidden things beneath indifference and the heart's eternal dissatisfaction.

TITLE_UR: اس نے تو اک نظر میں دیکھ کر
TITLE_EN: Uss Ne To Ek Nazar Mein Dekh Kar
CONTENT:
اس نے تو اک نظر میں دیکھ کر
سارے غم بھلا دیے

کیا کہیں کہ کس طرح
اس کی یاد آتی ہے

اب تو عادت سی ہے مجھے
اس کے غم میں مسکرانے کی

ہر گھڑی یہ نہیں ہوتا کہ
دل کو قرار آ جائے

فیضؔ کا دل ہے کہ اب بھی
اسی راہ تکا کرتا ہے
TRANSLATION_EN:
She, by looking just once
Made me forget all sorrows

What can I say, how
Her memory comes

Now it's become a habit for me
To smile in her grief

It's not every moment that
The heart finds peace

Faiz's heart is such that even now
It keeps staring at that same path
notes: A ghazal about the power of a single glance to erase sorrow and the habit of smiling in grief.

TITLE_UR: آج پھر اس کا خیال آیا
TITLE_EN: Aaj Phir Uss Ka Khayal Aaya
CONTENT:
آج پھر اس کا خیال آیا
دل نے چاہا کہ رو نہ پائیں

وہ جو بات اس نے کہی تھی
آج تک وہ بات ہے

ابھی تو کچھ اور دن ہیں
کہ جب اس کی باری آئے گی

کیا بتائیں کہ اس کی یاد سے
کیا کچھ مل گیا

فیضؔ کو اب کسی بات کی
خبر نہیں کچھ بھی
TRANSLATION_EN:
Today her thought came again
The heart wished not to weep

Those words she had spoken
Those words remain till today

There are still some days left
When her turn will come

How can I tell what
I gained from her memory?

Faiz now knows nothing
Of anything at all
notes: A ghazal about the persistence of memory and the final state of knowing nothing at all.

TITLE_UR: دل کو سمجھایا بہت پر وہ
TITLE_EN: Dil Ko Samjhaya Bahut Par Woh
CONTENT:
دل کو سمجھایا بہت پر وہ
اپنی ہی دھن میں لگا رہا

وہ جو اک بار ہنس کے ملے تھے
اب وہ ملنا کہاں

کیا بتائیں کہ اس کی یاد نے
کس طرح راتوں کو جگایا

اب بھی جب چاند نکلا کرتا ہے
دل اس کی گلی کو جاتا ہے

فیضؔ کا کام ہے دل لگانا
اب کسی سے لگائے کہ نہ لگائے
TRANSLATION_EN:
I tried hard to convince the heart, but it
Remained absorbed in its own obsession

Those who once met with a smile
Where is that meeting now?

How can I tell how her memory
Kept me awake at night?

Even now when the moon rises
The heart goes to her lane

Faiz's work is to love
Now whether to love someone or not
notes: A ghazal about the heart's obsession and the beautiful imagery of the heart going to the beloved's lane when the moon rises.

TITLE_UR: ہم نے سمجھا تھا کہ اب چین ملے گا
TITLE_EN: Hum Ne Samjha Tha Ke Ab Chain Mile Ga
CONTENT:
ہم نے سمجھا تھا کہ اب چین ملے گا
چین تو اور بھی دور نکل گیا

اس کی یاد میں جو گزری ہے
وہ کسی سے کیا کہیے

آج پھر وہ آئے تھے خواب میں
دل نے چاہا کہ جاگ نہ جائیں

اب کے اس نے اتنا ستایا
کہ دل نے دل سے کیا نہ کیا

فیضؔ کی زندگی تو کٹ ہی گئی
اب تم بتاؤ کہ اس نے کیا پایا
TRANSLATION_EN:
I thought now I would find peace
Peace only went further away

Whatever passed in her memory
How can I tell anyone?

Today she came again in a dream
The heart wished not to wake

This time she tormented so much
That the heart did everything to itself

Faiz's life has passed anyway
Now you tell me, what did he gain?
notes: A ghazal about peace receding further when sought, and the torment of dreams where the heart turns against itself.

TITLE_UR: وہ جو ہم سے مل کر مسکرائے تھے
TITLE_EN: Wo Jo Hum Se Mil Kar Muskurae Thay
CONTENT:
وہ جو ہم سے مل کر مسکرائے تھے
آج تک وہ مسکراہٹ یاد ہے

دل کو اب کسی بات سے
کوئی شکوہ نہیں

کیا بتائیں کہ اس کی یاد میں
کیا کچھ کھویا

اب تو یہ حال ہے کہ
خود سے بھی ملنے کا دل نہیں

فیضؔ کا کام ہے دل لگانا
اب یہی سلسلہ رہا
TRANSLATION_EN:
That smile with which she met me
I remember that smile till today

The heart now has no
Complaint about anything

How can I tell what all
I lost in her memory?

Now the state is such
That I don't even feel like meeting myself

Faiz's work is to love
Now this is the only routine left
notes: A ghazal about an enduring smile that remains in memory, and the state of not wanting to meet even oneself.

TITLE_UR: آج پھر اس کی یاد آئی تو
TITLE_EN: Aaj Phir Uss Ki Yaad Aai To
CONTENT:
آج پھر اس کی یاد آئی تو
سارا دن کھویا کھویا رہا

ہر گھڑی یہ نہیں ہوتا کہ
دل کو چین آ جائے

وہ جو اک بار مل گیا تھا
اس کا ملنا بھی کوئی ملنا تھا

ابھی تو ہم نے سوچا تھا
شاید کچھ اور بھی ہے

فیضؔ سے پوچھو کہ اس نے
کس کی یاد میں دن کاٹے
TRANSLATION_EN:
Today when her memory came
I remained lost the whole day

It's not every moment that
The heart finds peace

That meeting that happened once
That was some meeting indeed

I had just thought
Perhaps there is something more

Ask Faiz in whose memory
He spent his days
notes: A ghazal about a day lost entirely to memory, and the question of whose memory consumed Faiz's days.

TITLE_UR: دل ناشاد کو تجھ سے کوئی امید نہیں
TITLE_EN: Dil-e-Nashad Ko Tujh Se Koi Umeed Nahi
CONTENT:
دل ناشاد کو تجھ سے کوئی امید نہیں
پھر بھی ہر آن تجھی سے کوئی امید نہیں

یوں تو بہت ہیں محبت کے فسانے لیکن
تیرے قصے سے کبھی دل نہیں بھرتا

کبھی کبھی تو زمانے میں ہم بھی تھے اے دوست
اب تو یہ حال ہے کہ خود سے بھی ملاقات نہیں

فیضؔ اب اس کے بعد کیا ہوگا
دل کو تو اب کسی کی یاد نہیں
TRANSLATION_EN:
The sad heart has no hope from you
Yet every moment, no hope from you

There are many tales of love, but
My heart never tires of your story

Sometimes, O friend, I too existed in this world
Now the state is such that I don't even meet myself

Faiz, after this what will happen?
The heart now remembers no one
notes: A ghazal about hopeless hope and the endless fascination with the beloved's story.

TITLE_UR: وہ لوگ کہاں گئے جو کہتے تھے
TITLE_EN: Wo Log Kahan Gaye Jo Kehte Thay
CONTENT:
وہ لوگ کہاں گئے جو کہتے تھے
ہم تم کو زمانے بھر میں ڈھونڈیں گے

آج وہ خود ہی کھو گئے ہیں
کوئی پوچھے کہ کہاں گئے

دل میں اک حسرت سی رہ گئی ہے
کاش وہ ایک بار پھر آ جائیں

فیضؔ اب تو یہ حال ہے
کسی کی یاد بھی نہیں کسی کا غم بھی نہیں
TRANSLATION_EN:
Where have those people gone who said
We will search for you throughout the world

Today they themselves are lost
Someone should ask where they went

A longing remains in my heart
If only they would come once more

Faiz, now the state is such
Neither anyone's memory nor anyone's grief
notes: A ghazal about those who promised to search but themselves got lost, leaving only longing behind.

TITLE_UR: یوں تو سب ہیں غم زدہ لیکن
TITLE_EN: Yun To Sab Hain Gham-zada Lekin
CONTENT:
یوں تو سب ہیں غم زدہ لیکن
تیرا غم ہے کہ دل کو چھو گیا

دوسروں کے غم تو آنکھوں سے بہہ گئے
تیرا غم آنکھوں میں رہ گیا

کبھی کبھی یوں بھی ہوتا ہے
کوئی ملتا ہے تو دل دھڑکتا ہے

فیضؔ اب اس کے بعد کیا کیجیے
دل لگا کر بھی دل نہیں لگتا
TRANSLATION_EN:
Everyone is grief-stricken, but
Your grief touched my heart

Others' grief flowed from my eyes
Your grief remained in my eyes

Sometimes it happens like this
Someone meets and the heart beats

Faiz, after this what should I do?
Even after loving, the heart is not attached
notes: A ghazal distinguishing between ordinary grief and the beloved's grief that penetrates deeper.

TITLE_UR: اب کے ہم نے سوچا ہے
TITLE_EN: Ab Ke Hum Ne Socha Hai
CONTENT:
اب کے ہم نے سوچا ہے کہ اب نہیں ملنا
پھر بھی دل ہے کہ مانتا نہیں

تم بھی کبھی تو یاد آؤ گے
ہم بھی کبھی تو بھول جائیں گے

دل کی بات کسی سے کہی نہیں جاتی
ہم خاموش ہیں تو خاموشی بھی بھاری ہے

فیضؔ اب اس کے بعد کیا کہیے
دل نے چاہا مگر بات نہ بنی
TRANSLATION_EN:
This time I've decided not to meet
Yet the heart refuses to listen

Someday you too will come to mind
Someday I too will forget

The heart's words can't be told to anyone
I'm silent, and the silence too is heavy

Faiz, after this what can I say?
The heart wished, but matters didn't work out
notes: A ghazal about the conflict between decision and emotion, and the heaviness of silence.

TITLE_UR: کچھ تو دن میں بھی اندھیرا ہوتا
TITLE_EN: Kuchh To Din Mein Bhi Andhera Hota
CONTENT:
کچھ تو دن میں بھی اندھیرا ہوتا
کاش وہ یاد نہ آتا کوئی

رات بھر جاگتے رہنا ہے
کوئی آنے کا نہیں آنے کے ترستے ہی رہو

ہم نے سمجھا تھا کہ تم آؤ گے
تم نہ آئے تو کیا غم ہے

فیضؔ اب اس انتظار میں
عمر بھر کٹ گئی
TRANSLATION_EN:
If only there were darkness even during the day
If only no one came to mind

Must keep awake all night
No one comes, but keep longing for arrival

I thought you would come
If you didn't, what sorrow is that?

Faiz, in this waiting
My whole life has passed
notes: A ghazal wishing for darkness to escape memories, and the endless waiting that consumes life.

TITLE_UR: اس نے تو اک نظر میں دیکھ لیا
TITLE_EN: Uss Ne To Ek Nazar Mein Dekh Liya
CONTENT:
اس نے تو اک نظر میں دیکھ لیا
ہم نے سمجھا کہ دل لگا لیا

اب وہی بات نہیں رہی اے دوست
دل وہی ہے تو کیا ہوا

ہم تو سمجھے تھے کہ غم کم ہو گا
غم تو اور بھی بڑھ گیا ہے

فیضؔ اب اس کے بعد کیا ہوگا
دل کو تو اب کسی کی یاد نہیں
TRANSLATION_EN:
She looked just once
I thought I had won her heart

Now things aren't the same, O friend
What if the heart is the same?

I thought grief would decrease
Grief has only increased

Faiz, after this what will happen?
The heart now remembers no one
notes: A ghazal about misinterpretation of a glance and the paradox of grief increasing when expected to decrease.

TITLE_UR: دل کو سمجھا کر یہ کہا کرتے تھے
TITLE_EN: Dil Ko Samjha Kar Ye Kaha Karte Thay
CONTENT:
دل کو سمجھا کر یہ کہا کرتے تھے
اب کسی کے غم میں جلنا کیا

اس نے تو اک بار پکارا تھا
ہم سمجھے زندگی مل گئی

آج تک یاد ہے وہ بات کہ اس نے
مسکرا کر کہا تھا کبھی آنا

کچھ تو ہے جو اس نے چھپایا ہے
ورنہ اتنا تو کوئی بے وفا نہیں ہوتا

فیضؔ کا دل ہے کہ اب بھی
اس کی یاد میں کھویا رہتا ہے
TRANSLATION_EN:
Trying to console the heart, I'd say this
Why now burn in anyone's grief?

She called out just once
I thought I had found life

I still remember those words when she
Smiling, said: come sometime

There's something she's hidden
Otherwise no one is so unfaithful

Faiz's heart is such that even now
It remains lost in her memory
notes: A ghazal about a single call that promised life and the mystery of hidden unfaithfulness.

TITLE_UR: آج پھر دل چاہتا ہے کہ
TITLE_EN: Aaj Phir Dil Chahta Hai Ke
CONTENT:
آج پھر دل چاہتا ہے کہ
اس سے جا کر ملیں

ابھی تو ہم نے سوچا تھا کہ
شاید وہ بھول گئے

کیا کہیں کس طرح گزری رات
اس کی یاد آتی رہی

ہر چند ہم نے صبر کیا
دل تو ہے کہ بے قرار رہا

فیضؔ سے پوچھو کہ اس نے
کس کی یاد میں دن کاٹے
TRANSLATION_EN:
Today again the heart desires
To go and meet her

I had just thought that
Perhaps she had forgotten

What can I say, how the night passed?
Her memory kept coming

However much I tried to be patient
The heart remained restless

Ask Faiz in whose memory
He spent his days
notes: A ghazal about recurring desire to meet despite thinking the beloved has forgotten.

TITLE_UR: ہم نے سمجھا تھا کہ وہ بھول گئے
TITLE_EN: Hum Ne Samjha Tha Ke Woh Bhool Gaye
CONTENT:
ہم نے سمجھا تھا کہ وہ بھول گئے
وہ تو ہمیں یاد کر رہے تھے

آج پھر وہ آئے یاد
دل نے چاہا کہ کھو جائیں

کچھ اس کی یاد نے ایسے گھیرا
کہ خیال بھی نہ بچا

ابھی تو ہم نے سوچا تھا
شاید کچھ اور دن ہیں

فیضؔ کی زندگی کا تو
یہی عالم رہا
TRANSLATION_EN:
I thought she had forgotten
She was actually remembering me

Today she came to memory again
The heart wished to lose itself

Her memory surrounded me so
That no thought remained

I had just thought
Perhaps there are still some days left

Faiz's life has always been
In this same state
notes: A ghazal about the irony of assuming the beloved has forgotten when she actually remembers.

TITLE_UR: دل تو بہل گیا تھا کچھ دیر
TITLE_EN: Dil To Behal Gaya Tha Kuchh Der
CONTENT:
دل تو بہل گیا تھا کچھ دیر
پھر وہی یاد پھر وہی غم

اس کی گلی میں جاتے ہیں
پر اب وہ بات نہیں

کیا کہیں کہ کس طرح
اس نے یاد رکھا

اب تو آنکھوں میں بس گیا ہے
وہ کہیں اور ہے ہی نہیں

فیضؔ کا دل ہے کہ اب بھی
اسی دھن میں لگا رہتا ہے
TRANSLATION_EN:
The heart was distracted for a while
Then again that memory, again that grief

I go to her lane
But now that magic is gone

What can I say, how
She remembered

Now she has settled in my eyes
She is nowhere else at all

Faiz's heart is such that even now
It remains absorbed in that same obsession
notes: A ghazal about the cycle of distraction and return to memory, with the beloved dwelling in the eyes.

TITLE_UR: اب اس کے بعد بھی دل لگتا ہے
TITLE_EN: Ab Uss Ke Baad Bhi Dil Lagta Hai
CONTENT:
اب اس کے بعد بھی دل لگتا ہے
کچھ تو ہے جس کا غم کھاتے ہیں

رات بھر جاگتے رہنا ہے
کوئی آنے کا نہیں آنے کے ترستے ہی رہو

دل کی بات کسی سے کہی نہیں جاتی
ہم خاموش ہیں تو خاموشی بھی بھاری ہے

فیضؔ اب اس کے بعد کیا کہیے
دل نے چاہا مگر بات نہ بنی
TRANSLATION_EN:
Even after this, the heart is attached
There is something whose grief I consume

Must keep awake all night
No one comes, but keep longing for arrival

The heart's words can't be told to anyone
I'm silent, and the silence too is heavy

Faiz, after this what can I say?
The heart wished, but matters didn't work out
notes: A ghazal about the persistence of attachment despite everything, and the heaviness of silence.

TITLE_UR: ہم سے جو بات کہی تم نے سن لی ہم نے
TITLE_EN: Hum Se Jo Baat Kahi Tum Ne Sun Li Hum Ne
CONTENT:
ہم سے جو بات کہی تم نے سن لی ہم نے
دل کی دنیا میں اتر کر اسے بسا لیا

تم نے کہا تھا کہ بھول جاؤ گے
ہم نے کہا تھا کہ یاد رکھیں گے

کبھی کبھی یوں بھی ہوتا ہے
کوئی آتا ہے تو دل دھڑکتا ہے

فیضؔ اب اس کے بعد کیا ہوگا
دل کو تو اب کسی کی یاد نہیں
TRANSLATION_EN:
Whatever you said to me, I heard it
It descended into my heart's world and I cherished it

You had said you would forget
I had said I would remember

Sometimes it happens like this
Someone comes and the heart beats

Faiz, after this what will happen?
The heart now remembers no one
notes: A ghazal about words that are heard and cherished, and the conflict between promises of forgetting and remembering.

TITLE_UR: یوں تو ہر چہرہ پہ اجنبیت چھائی ہے
TITLE_EN: Yun To Har Chehra Pe Ajnabiyat Chhayi Hai
CONTENT:
یوں تو ہر چہرہ پہ اجنبیت چھائی ہے
پر تیرے چہرے پہ اجنبیت نہیں چھائی

دل کی دنیا میں اتر آئی ہے تیری صورت
آنکھوں میں بس گئی ہے تیری یاد

کچھ تو ہے جو چھپایا ہے تم نے
ورنہ اتنا تو کوئی بے وفا نہیں ہوتا

فیضؔ اب اس کے بعد کیا کہیے
دل نے چاہا مگر بات نہ بنی
TRANSLATION_EN:
Every face is covered with strangeness
But your face is not covered with strangeness

Your image has descended into my heart's world
Your memory has settled in my eyes

There's something you've hidden
Otherwise no one is so unfaithful

Faiz, after this what can I say?
The heart wished, but matters didn't work out
notes: A ghazal about the beloved's face being the only one not strange, and the mystery of hidden unfaithfulness.

TITLE_UR: ہم نے چاہا تو بہت پر نہ ملا
TITLE_EN: Hum Ne Chaha To Bahut Par Na Mila
CONTENT:
ہم نے چاہا تو بہت پر نہ ملا
شاید قسمت میں ہی نہ تھا ملنا

اب اسے بھولنے کا غم ہے
وہ بھی کوئی بھولنا ہے

دل کے جلنے کا بھی مزا ہے کوئی
جب کسی کی یاد میں جلنے لگیں

فیضؔ اب اس کے بعد کیا کیجیے
دل لگا کر بھی دل نہیں لگتا
TRANSLATION_EN:
I wished so much but didn't find her
Perhaps meeting was not in my fate

Now there's grief of forgetting her
And that too is some kind of forgetting

There is some pleasure in the heart's burning
When it starts burning in someone's memory

Faiz, after this what should I do?
Even after loving, the heart is not attached
notes: A ghazal about the grief of forgetting and the paradoxical pleasure found in the heart's burning.

TITLE_UR: یوں نہیں کہ اس کا غم کم ہو گیا
TITLE_EN: Yun Nahin Ke Uss Ka Gham Kam Ho Gaya
CONTENT:
یوں نہیں کہ اس کا غم کم ہو گیا
دل کو اب اس کی عادت سی ہو گئی

وہ جو ملتے تھے کبھی راہوں میں
اب وہ راہیں بھی اجڑ گئی ہیں

کیا ملا ہے اسے فیضؔ کی یاد میں
وہ تو اب بھی بے خبر ہے اس سے

اب اسے بھولنے کا غم ہے
وہ بھی کوئی بھولنا ہے
TRANSLATION_EN:
It's not that her grief has diminished
The heart has just grown accustomed to it

Those paths where we used to meet
Now those paths too are desolate

What has she gained from Faiz's memory?
She is still unaware of it

Now there's grief of forgetting her
And that too is some kind of forgetting
notes: A ghazal about how grief becomes habitual, and the desolation of paths once walked together.

TITLE_UR: اب تو گزرے دن بھی یاد نہیں
TITLE_EN: Ab To Guzray Din Bhi Yaad Nahin
CONTENT:
اب تو گزرے دن بھی یاد نہیں
اب تو آنے والے کل بھی یاد نہیں

تم بھی کبھی تو یاد آؤ گے
ہم بھی کبھی تو بھول جائیں گے

دل کی بات کسی سے کہی نہیں جاتی
ہم خاموش ہیں تو خاموشی بھی بھاری ہے

فیضؔ اب اس کے بعد کیا کہیے
دل نے چاہا مگر بات نہ بنی
TRANSLATION_EN:
Now even the days that have passed are not remembered
Now even the tomorrows to come are not remembered

Someday you too will come to mind
Someday I too will forget

The heart's words can't be told to anyone
I'm silent, and the silence too is heavy

Faiz, after this what can I say?
The heart wished, but matters didn't work out
notes: A ghazal about the erasure of both past and future from memory, leaving only a heavy silence.

TITLE_UR: کچھ نہیں تو یہ دل ہے
TITLE_EN: Kuchh Nahin To Ye Dil Hai
CONTENT:
کچھ نہیں تو یہ دل ہے
اس کو سنبھالے رکھیے

آج تک یاد ہے وہ لمحہ
جب اس نے آنکھوں سے آنکھیں ملا کر کہا تھا

ہم نے سمجھا تھا کہ سب بھول گئے
آج معلوم ہوا کچھ نہیں بھولے

اب اس کے بعد بھی دل لگتا ہے
کچھ تو ہے جس کا نام لیتے ہیں

فیضؔ سے پوچھو کہ اس نے کیا پایا
اس نے تو سب کچھ اس پہ لٹا دیا
TRANSLATION_EN:
If nothing else, there is this heart
We should keep it safe

I remember that moment till today
When she met my eyes and said

I thought everyone had forgotten
Today I learned no one has forgotten

Even after this, the heart is attached
There is something whose name we take

Ask Faiz what he gained
He sacrificed everything for her
notes: A ghazal about the preciousness of the heart, the persistence of memory, and total sacrifice for the beloved.

TITLE_UR: aaj ik aur baras biit gaya us ke baghair
TITLE_EN: Aaj Ik Aur Baras Beet Gaya Us Ke Baghair
CONTENT:
aaj ik aur baras biit gaya us ke baghair
jis ke hote hue hote the zamane mere

us ne chaha to zamane ne bhi chaha lekin
woh mohabbat kabhi puri na hui hum dono ki

dil mein ik baat thi kehni thi na kehni bhi thi
woh na kehne ka fasana bhi bahut hai aage

faiz ab apne zamane mein kahin rehte hi nahin
log kehte hain ke faiz ab bhi wahi hai magar
TRANSLATION_EN:
Another year has passed without him
Without whom my times used to be

If he had wanted, the world would have wanted too
But that love of ours was never fulfilled

There was something in my heart to say and not to say
That tale of not telling is yet to be told

Faiz no longer lives in his times
People say Faiz is still the same, but
notes: A reflective ghazal about the passage of time and enduring love. The opening line is one of Faiz's most famous verses about longing and remembrance [citation:3].

TITLE_UR: sham-e-firaq ab na puchh aai aur aa ke tal gai
TITLE_EN: Sham-e-Firaq Ab Na Puchh Aai Aur Aa Ke Tal Gai
CONTENT:
sham-e-firaq ab na puchh aai aur aa ke tal gai
dil tha ke phir bahal gai jaan thi ke phir sambhal gai

bazm-e-khayal mein tere husn ki shama jal gai
dard ka chand bujh gaya hijr ki raat dhal gai

jab tujhe yaad kar liya subh mahak mahak utthi
jab tera gham jaga liya raat machal machal gai

dil se to har moamla kar ke chale the saaf hum
kahne mein un ke samne baat badal badal gai

akhir-e-shab ke hum-safar faiz na jaane kya hue
rah gai kis jagah saba subh kidhar nikal gai
TRANSLATION_EN:
Query not my lonely night, it came and went away
The heart was consoled, and life managed not to fray

In the parlour of my thoughts, your beauty's lamp was lit
The moon of pain vanished, the night of parting quit

When your thoughts arose, fragrant was the morn
When your sorrow woke, the night was all forlorn

I ventured forth with all my thoughts properly arranged
In her presence when I spoke, the meaning had all changed

Where the night's companions went, I do not know
Where did the breeze vanish, where did the morning go
notes: Written at Jinnah Hospital, Karachi in 1953. This ghazal appears in 'Gulon Mein Rang Bhare' and 'Nuskha Hai Wafa' [citation:2]. The translation by Agha Shahid Ali captures its essence.

TITLE_UR: aur bhi dukh hain zamane mein mohabbat ke siwa
TITLE_EN: Aur Bhi Dukh Hain Zamane Mein Mohabbat Ke Siwa
CONTENT:
aur bhi dukh hain zamane mein mohabbat ke siwa
rahaten aur bhi hain wasl ki rahat ke siwa

dil na-umeed to nahin nakam hi to hai
lambi hai gham ki sham magar sham hi to hai

kar raha tha gham-e-jahan ka hisab
aaj tum yaad be-hisab aae

aur kya dekhne ko baqi hai
aap se dil laga ke dekh liya
TRANSLATION_EN:
There are other sorrows in this world besides love
There are other pleasures besides the comfort of union

The heart is not hopeless, it's just unsuccessful
Long is the evening of grief, but it's just an evening

I was calculating the sorrows of the world
Today you came to mind beyond all calculation

What else is there now for me to view
I have experienced being in love with you
notes: A collection of famous couplets from various Faiz ghazals. The first couplet is particularly renowned and appears in Rekhta's collection of Faiz's poetry [citation:3].

TITLE_UR: ranjish hi sahi dil hi dukhane ke liye aa
TITLE_EN: Ranjish Hi Sahi Dil Hi Dukhane Ke Liye Aa
CONTENT:
ranjish hi sahi dil hi dukhane ke liye aa
aa phir se mujhe chhod ke jaane ke liye aa

kya pyaar ki raahon mein kabhi zakhm nahi tha
tum to mujhe aur bhi rulaane ke liye aa

vo log bahut khush-qismat the ishq mein lekin
hum to kabhi be-chain hue to nahin aae

ab ke milo to kaho kyun na milo ge kabhi
kal kahoge ke hum kal to nahin aae
TRANSLATION_EN:
Let it be displeasure, come to break my heart
Come to leave me once again after we start

Was there never a wound on love's path before?
You've come to make me weep even more

Those in love were very fortunate, but
When I grew restless, no one ever came

Now when we meet, say why won't we meet again?
Tomorrow you'll say I didn't come yesterday
notes: A ghazal exploring the paradox of seeking the beloved even when they come to cause pain. The opening line is one of Urdu poetry's most famous verses.

TITLE_UR: gulon mein rang bhare baad-e-nau-bahar chale
TITLE_EN: Gulon Mein Rang Bhare Baad-e-Nau-Bahar Chale
CONTENT:
gulon mein rang bhare baad-e-nau-bahar chale
chale bhi aao ke gulshan ka karobar chale

qafas udaas hai yaron sabaa se kuchh to kaho
kahin ye to nahin ki ab-e-rawan se takraar

chaman mein raqs-e-saba dekhte hain aankhon se
wo zulf-e-yaar ki khushbu liye huye aae
TRANSLATION_EN:
The flowers are colored, the spring breeze blows
Come now, for the garden's waiting calls

The cage is sad, friends, say something to the breeze
Perhaps it's having some dispute with the flowing stream

We watch the dance of the breeze in the garden
She came carrying the fragrance of the beloved's locks
notes: A beautiful spring-themed ghazal from Faiz's early period, featured in his first collection 'Naqsh-e-Faryadi' (1941).

TITLE_UR: yeh daagh daagh ujala yeh shab-gazida sehar
TITLE_EN: Yeh Daagh Daagh Ujala Yeh Shab-Gazida Sehar
CONTENT:
yeh daagh daagh ujala yeh shab-gazida sehar
woh intezaar tha jiska yeh intezaar to hai

yeh tazagi bahar ke qabil nahin magar
kuchh aur hai ke phir bhi gulaN mein bahar hai

woh ek fursat-e-gunah mili woh bhi chaar din
dekhe hain hum ne hausle parwardigar ke
TRANSLATION_EN:
This stained light, this night-bitten dawn
That waiting for which this waiting was done

This freshness is not worthy of spring, but
Something else is there, still there's spring in the garden

One opportunity for sin came, and that too for four days
We have seen the courage of the Almighty
notes: A revolutionary ghazal that uses imagery of a stained dawn to symbolize the struggle for freedom. From Faiz's collection 'Dast-e-Tah-e-Sang'.

TITLE_UR: hum ke thareek rahon mein maare gaye
TITLE_EN: Hum Ke Thareek Rahon Mein Maare Gaye
CONTENT:
hum ke thareek rahon mein maare gaye
kis ke aane ka intezaar tha

woh keh gaye ke tujh se mohabbat nahi hai lekin
kuchh aur baat hai jo unhein be-khudi kiye hue

jaane woh kis hisaab mein khoye hue hain log
kuchh hum bhi apni yaad mein gum ho gaye to kya

faiz koi nahin hai mere dil ke siwa
jis ko main apne gham ka fasana sunaun
TRANSLATION_EN:
We who were slain on unlit pathways
Whose arrival were we waiting for?

She said she has no love for me, but
Something else keeps her entranced still

Who knows in what accounts people are lost
If I too got lost in my memories, so what?

Faiz, there is no one except my heart
To whom I can tell the tale of my sorrow
notes: A collection of verses from Faiz's prison poetry, featured in 'Zindan Nama' (1956), reflecting his experience of imprisonment.

TITLE_UR: woh log bahut khush-qismat thay
TITLE_EN: Woh Log Bahut Khush-Qismat Thay
CONTENT:
woh log bahut khush-qismat thay
jo ishq ko kaam samajhte thay

hum to zinda hain isi aas pe
ke kabhi to mulaqaat ho gi

dil ke veerane mein ek shama jalaai hum ne
koi to aae use dekhne wala

faiz ab is intezaar mein kat gayi umar
woh aaya bhi to kya tha jo aana tha
TRANSLATION_EN:
Those people were very fortunate
Who considered love as work

I am alive with this hope
That someday we will meet

In the heart's desert, I lit a candle
Let someone come to see it

Faiz, my life passed in this waiting
Even if she came, what was meant to be?
notes: A philosophical ghazal comparing the fortune of those who could pursue love as a profession. The poet reflects on the nature of waiting and hope.

TITLE_UR: woh baat saare fasaane mein jis ka zikr na tha
TITLE_EN: Woh Baat Saare Fasane Mein Jis Ka Zikr Na Tha
CONTENT:
woh baat saare fasaane mein jis ka zikr na tha
woh baat un ko bahut na-gawar guzri hai

kuchh to hai jo unhein apna sa lagta hai
warna itna to koi bewafa nahin hota

dil ko samjha kar kaha karte the
ab kisi ke gham mein kya rakha hai

faiz is ke baad bhi dil lagta hai
kuchh to hai jis ka gham khaate hain
TRANSLATION_EN:
That thing in the whole tale which wasn't mentioned
That thing became very unpleasant for her

There's something that feels like her own to her
Otherwise no one is so unfaithful

Consoling the heart, I used to say
What's there in anyone's grief now?

Faiz, even after this, the heart is attached
There's something whose grief we consume
notes: A ghazal about the unspoken elements in love and the mystery of attachment.

TITLE_UR: zulmat-kada
TITLE_EN: Zulmat-Kada
CONTENT:
zulmat-kada hai aalam, roshni-kada to hai
kuchh apni zaat se puchho, kuchh ghair se suno

yeh raat bhar ki masafat, yeh subah ka safar
kahan se aaye thay hum, kahan tak gaye

dil mein koi baat hai jo kahin nahin jaati
aankhon mein koi khwab hai jo dekha nahin jaata

faiz is shehar mein kis se milen
har chehra pe zakhm hain, har lab pe dard
TRANSLATION_EN:
The world is a realm of darkness, yet a realm of light
Ask something of yourself, hear something from others

This night-long journey, this morning's travel
Where had we come from, and where did we go?

There's something in the heart that won't be told
There's a dream in the eyes that won't be seen

Faiz, whom should I meet in this city?
Every face has wounds, every lip has pain
notes: A ghazal exploring the duality of existence - darkness and light, pain and hope.

TITLE_UR: raat yun dil mein teri khoi hui yaad aai
TITLE_EN: Raat Yun Dil Mein Teri Khoi Hui Yaad Aai
CONTENT:
raat yun dil mein teri khoi hui yaad aai
jaise veerane mein chupke se bahar aa jaye

jaise sahron mein koi khwab mein khoyaa ho
jaise sabze mein koi phool khilaa na ho

tere aane ki khabar jaise mili ho mujh ko
jaise andheri raat mein suraj nikal aaya ho
TRANSLATION_EN:
Last night your lost memory came to my heart
Like spring silently arriving in a desert

Like someone lost in a dream in the mornings
Like a flower that hasn't bloomed in the garden

As if I received news of your coming
As if the sun rose in a dark night
notes: A ghazal about the sudden arrival of memory, using beautiful nature imagery.

TITLE_UR: ab ke hum bichhde to shayad kabhi khwabon mein milen
TITLE_EN: Ab Ke Hum Bichhde To Shayad Kabhi Khwabon Mein Milen
CONTENT:
ab ke hum bichhde to shayad kabhi khwabon mein milen
jis tarah sukhe hue phool kitabon mein milen

dil ki taskin ko ai faiz utna hi kaafi tha
ke woh yaad aaye ke woh yaad aaye ke woh yaad aaye
TRANSLATION_EN:
Now that we've parted, perhaps we'll meet in dreams
Like dried flowers found in books

To soothe the heart, Faiz, this much was enough
That she came to mind, that she came to mind, that she came to mind
notes: A famous ghazal about separation and the hope of meeting in dreams. The imagery of dried flowers in books is particularly poignant.

TITLE_UR: tumhare dar se agar hum nikal bhi jaate to kya jaate
TITLE_EN: Tumhare Dar Se Agar Hum Nikal Bhi Jaate To Kya Jaate
CONTENT:
tumhare dar se agar hum nikal bhi jaate to kya jaate
kisi ke ho na sakte the kisi ka gham na khaate the

use bhi hum se koi shikwa tha apni bewafai ka
use bhi hum ne chaha tha use bhi hum ne chaaha tha

woh hum se ruth kar jab bhi gaye to yun laga
ke ab ke hum unhein mana lenge phir bhi na aaye
TRANSLATION_EN:
Even if I had left your doorstep, where would I go?
I could belong to no one, could grieve for no one

She too had a complaint about her own unfaithfulness
She too had loved me, she too had loved me

When she left in anger, it felt
That this time I'd win her back - still she didn't come
notes: A ghazal exploring the impossibility of leaving the beloved and the paradox of mutual complaints.

TITLE_UR: yaad ne aaj bada dhyan se dekha hoga
TITLE_EN: Yaad Ne Aaj Bada Dhyan Se Dekha Hoga
CONTENT:
yaad ne aaj bada dhyan se dekha hoga
kal jo hum bhool gaye hain unhein yaad aaya hoga

kitni mushkil se mohabbat ki thi hum ne jise
us ne bhi dil mein kahi dard chhupaya hoga

hum to samjhe the ke woh bhool gaye sab kuchh
kal jo milne ko aaye to kuchh yaad aaya hoga
TRANSLATION_EN:
Memory must have looked at me very carefully today
She whom I forgot yesterday must have remembered

Whom I loved with such difficulty
She too must have hidden some pain in her heart

I thought she had forgotten everything
When she came to meet yesterday, she must have remembered something
notes: A ghazal personifying memory and exploring the mutual nature of remembrance and pain.

TITLE_UR: kal chaman se guzra to yun laga
TITLE_EN: Kal Chaman Se Guzra To Yun Laga
CONTENT:
kal chaman se guzra to yun laga
jaise aaj bhi wahi bahar hai

phool to khile the lekin un mein
teri khushbu ki kami si thi

bulbulon ke nagme to the magar
un mein teri baat na thi

faiz is shehar mein ab kya rakha hai
jab se woh chale gaye
TRANSLATION_EN:
Yesterday when I passed by the garden, it felt
As if even today it's the same spring

Flowers had bloomed, but in them
There was an absence of your fragrance

The nightingales sang, but
Your voice was missing from them

Faiz, what is left in this city now
Since she has left?
notes: A ghazal about how the garden loses its charm after the beloved's departure, despite outward signs of spring.

TITLE_UR: woh aaj aangan mein khwabon ki fasal boye hue
TITLE_EN: Woh Aaj Aangan Mein Khwabon Ki Fasal Boye Hue
CONTENT:
woh aaj aangan mein khwabon ki fasal boye hue
hawa mein teri hi khushbu mahak rahi hai

kabhi kabhi aisa bhi hota hai ke hum
tere baghair bhi khush hain magar

teri yaad ka aalam kuchh aur hai
jaise koi samandar dil mein utar aaya ho
TRANSLATION_EN:
Today in the courtyard, she's sowing a crop of dreams
Your fragrance is blooming in the air

Sometimes it happens that I
Am happy even without you, but

The state of your memory is something else
As if an ocean has descended into my heart
notes: A ghazal using agricultural imagery to describe the cultivation of memories and dreams.

TITLE_UR: kabhi hum bhi tum bhi aangan mein tanha
TITLE_EN: Kabhi Hum Bhi Tum Bhi Aangan Mein Tanha
CONTENT:
kabhi hum bhi tum bhi aangan mein tanha
kabhi hum nahin tum nahin aangan hai

teri aankhon mein jaise nami thi kuchh
meri aankhon mein jaise gham tha kuchh

woh hum se bichhde to yun laga
jaise apna sa koi kho gaya

faiz ab is ke baad kya rakkha hai
jab se woh hum se juda hua
TRANSLATION_EN:
Sometimes you and I are alone in the courtyard
Sometimes neither you nor I, only the courtyard remains

In your eyes there was some moisture
In my eyes there was some sorrow

When she parted from me, it felt
As if I had lost someone of my own

Faiz, after this what is left
Since she has separated from me?
notes: A ghazal exploring presence and absence, self and other, in the space of the courtyard.

TITLE_UR: ek din aisa bhi aayega
TITLE_EN: Ek Din Aisa Bhi Aayega
CONTENT:
ek din aisa bhi aayega
jab woh khud mujhe dhundhti phiregi

tere dar se hum ko koi na rokega
tere shehar mein hum kisi se na darenge

woh khud apne haathon se likhegi mohabbat ka paigham
aur hum use kabhi na bhoolenge
TRANSLATION_EN:
A day will also come
When she herself will wander searching for me

No one will stop me at your doorstep
In your city, I will fear no one

She herself will write love's message with her own hands
And I will never forget her
notes: A hopeful ghazal about the reversal of roles when the beloved will become the seeker.

TITLE_UR: raat bhar baat karte rahe
TITLE_EN: Raat Bhar Baat Karte Rahe
CONTENT:
raat bhar baat karte rahe
subh hone ki khabar na hui

dil ki duniya mein utar aai hai woh
aankhon mein bas gayi hai us ki yaad

kabhi kabhi aisa bhi hota hai
koi aata hai to dil dhadakta hai

faiz ab is ke baad kya kahiye
dil laga kar bhi dil nahin lagta
TRANSLATION_EN:
We talked all night
We didn't know when morning came

She has descended into my heart's world
Her memory has settled in my eyes

Sometimes it happens like this
Someone comes and the heart beats

Faiz, after this what can I say?
Even after loving, the heart is not attached
notes: A ghazal about the timelessness of conversation with the beloved and the persistence of memory.
